perturbation.original_text: ChipMOS TECHNOLOGIES INC., a company incorporated under the laws of Taiwan (“ChipMOS”), and Tsinghua Unigroup Ltd. (“Tsinghua Unigroup”), a company incorporated under the laws of the People’s Republic of China (“PRC”). ChipMOS and Tsinghua Unigroup shall collectively be referred to as the “Parties.”
perturbation.changed_text: ChipMOS TECHNOLOGIES INC., a company incorporated under the laws of Taiwan (“ChipMOS” or “Service Provider”), and Tsinghua Unigroup Ltd. (“Tsinghua Unigroup” or “Client”), a company incorporated under the laws of the People’s Republic of China (“PRC”). ChipMOS and Tsinghua Unigroup shall collectively be referred to as the “Parties.”
perturbation.explanation: Introduces ambiguity by using 'Service Provider' and 'Client' interchangeably with 'ChipMOS' and 'Tsinghua Unigroup'. This can lead to confusion regarding their roles and obligations within specific clauses.

perturbation.original_text: Each of the Parties covenants to, after the Closing Date, designate related staff to hold regular meetings to propose a specific plan and schedule in connection with Sections 1.1 and 1.2 herein, perform the specific plan together and review the implementation status. Each Party shall use its reasonable best efforts to provide immediate assistance to, and actively cooperate with, the other Party, to implement this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: Each of the Participants covenants to, after the Closing Date, designate related staff to hold occasional meetings to propose a flexible plan and schedule in connection with Sections 1.1 and 1.2 herein, perform the general plan together and note the implementation status. Each Participant shall use its reasonable efforts to provide occasional assistance to, and passively cooperate with, the other Participant, to partially implement this Agreement.
perturbation.explanation: By changing 'Parties' to 'Participants', 'regular meetings' to 'occasional meetings', 'specific plan' to 'flexible plan', 'reasonable best efforts' to 'reasonable efforts', 'immediate assistance' to 'occasional assistance', 'actively cooperate' to 'passively cooperate', and 'implement this Agreement' to 'partially implement this Agreement', creates conflicting obligations. It's unclear if 'Participants' is the same as 'Parties'.

perturbation.original_text: The Parties agree that the Parties will not disclose information in connection with the execution, existence, content, and performance of this Agreement to any third party before the Parties have made an announcement to the public pursuant to Section 3.11 of this Agreement. However, the foregoing restriction shall not apply to disclosure made to the board of the directors, management team, and relevant employees who need to know such information, attorneys, accountants, financial counsel, and competent authorities for the purposes of performing this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text: The Individuals agree that the Stakeholders will not disclose details in connection with the completion, presence, substance, and execution of this Contract to any outside entity before the Principals have released a statement to the community pursuant to Section 3.11 of this Contract. However, the prior restraint shall not extend to revelations presented to the directorate, leadership cadre, and allied personnel who are required to possess such intelligence, legal representatives, bookkeepers, monetary advocates, and capable bodies for the motivations of enacting this Contract.
perturbation.explanation: The original text uses 'Parties', 'Agreement', 'third party', 'announcement', 'board of directors', 'management team', 'employees', 'attorneys', 'accountants', 'financial counsel', and 'competent authorities'. By changing these to 'Individuals', 'Stakeholders', 'details', 'completion', 'presence', 'substance', 'Contract', 'outside entity', 'Principals', 'statement', 'community', 'prior restraint', 'revelations', 'directorate', 'leadership cadre', 'allied personnel', 'intelligence', 'legal representatives', 'bookkeepers', 'monetary advocates', and 'capable bodies', the definitions and specific context are now very ambigious.
